alert.note: Alert for St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 19 at 9:43PM AKST until February 22 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AKST MONDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 45 below zero. For the Winter Storm Watch, blizzard conditions, heavy snow, and light freezing rain possible. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze possible. Winds could gust as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 9 AM AKST Monday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late Monday night through Wednesday evening. Conditions will deteriorate over St Lawrence Island late Monday night and along the Bering Strait Coast Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could blow items around. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Two storms will impact the area. The first system will arrive late Monday night with a brief break between systems Wednesday morning.
info.instruction: A Wind Chill Advisory means that cold air and sustained wind speeds of 15 mph or more will create low wind chills. Frost bite and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast
